title: Honors Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted by leaders in the organization. I felt respected and well listened to. They had good questions that related to my current role, and I had a good time. I would recommend that you think about what you would change from the time you were a mentee and have a meaningful contribution though up.
Interview Questions: What is something you would change and why?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Based on CGPA, technical skills and academic experience. The interview process is very straight forward. You just need to apply and mostly the skill set matches. Based on CGPA, technical skills and academic experience.
Interview Questions: What machine learning tools have you used

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was well organized and not too intense. Separated into three sections and got to meet several people in the process. They made me feel welcomed which helped to not be too nervous. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Name three accomplishments you are most proud of.

title: Strength and Conditioning Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Its relatively easy and laid back. The requirements to meet aren't much to meet. The staff are looking for college students who have a rudimentary knowledge about weight lifting.  Overall, probably one of the easiest interviews I personally have ever had.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this job

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: The professor will send you email of time schedule first, then during the interview, my research experience, research interest,  possible research plan and professor's current project will be discussed. Apart from that, some questions were asked to test my basic knowledge in the professpr's area.
Interview Questions: Self introductions, research experience and basic undegraduate knowledge relevant to the professor's project.

title: International Recruitment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really speedy - within a week I'd heard from UNL about my application, had a phone interview with HR and two interviews with managing staff and directors.
Interview Questions: They asked me to create an Admissions-style presentation so that they could get a sense of my presenting skills

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Met with multiple faculty members during my visit, each was attentive and provided helpful insight. Expectations were clearly communicated. The itinerary included meeting faculty and students but also included “down time” and a lunch with students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join the program?

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and were contacted few days later through email. In the interview, some general questions were asked and the questions are generally easy to be answered. It was an one on one interview.
Interview Questions: What do you usually do in your free time?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Common interview questions; "what is your greatest strength", etc. Short and to the point, knew by the end of the interview if I would get offered the position. Small talk during the interview process calmed my nerves and made me feel more at ease!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: It is based on curriculum analysis, cover letters, and interviews with professionals in the area in which the vacancy works. However, requirements may vary between departments and institutes, and they can ask for more information
Interview Questions: What are the professional goals

title: Laser/Optical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was initial screening of CV related to job and the later a brief interview about the knowledge of job requirements. Especially, hand on experience on lasers, lasers troubleshooting, optimization.
Interview Questions: why do you want to join?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: They took me in and interviewed me. Then after the interview on the same day, they toured me around. Then I was hired a couple of weeks later. Finally trained the first time before working
Interview Questions: How would you teach a lesson?

title: Project Manager Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: I was informed about the position through a friend who knew the manager, we were connected and met up to chat about the position. The interview process was more like a "get to know you" chat and deciding if it'll work with my schedule.
Interview Questions: Will you be available every day M-F, at least for a few hours?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: submitted my transcript and sent and email to the professor. We had a phone interview for about 40min then I got a research assistant offer. I know this professor through a friend so it's kind of easy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Tied in with grad school process. Grad school interview was a 6 person panel - probably 35-40 min and fairly difficult questions. Definitely had to prepare. Was placed in GA role automatically after that
Interview Questions: Three specific facts about the college of business

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical video interview I think. It took them 4 months to finally reach out to me to schedule a video interview. 3 professors including 1 dean attanded. I guess I did not do well since it was my very first interview. And I knew that I probably wouldn't get the job so I didn't ask for updates. I eventually got an email saying I didn't get the job about another 4 months after the interview.
Interview Questions: Questsions were related to job duties and required skills. And there were some behaviour questions as well.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Usually just a conversation with the professor you're working with. It will be the usual questions that they ask, but during the interview they will mostly just be looking at your personality and characteristics on how you fit in with the lab.
Interview Questions: What is one weakness that you have?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: First you filled out an application online and there were multiple questions with resume submition. Then there was a one on one interview with one of the higher ups. Finally then a 6 hour long process of interview rounds in groups
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a mentor

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
- Developing a new strategy to construct a series of multivariate metal−organic frameworks (MOFs) via secondary linker insertion.
- Developing a new series of MOFs with thermally activated delayed fluorescence (TADF) for photocatalysis.
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you worked effectively under pressure

title: UNL Dairy Store Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Brief 40-60 minute interview with your basic questions. Questions about yourself and your previous experience as well as your availability. Can you work on game days?  How are your customer service skills?
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: Database Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and great balance of technical and behavioral questions. 1 round of panel of 4 interviewers. I showed them a sample of some of the projects I had worked on before.
Interview Questions: Explain how you made a mistake at work and what lessons you learned from your mistake and how did you fix it?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Super easy and relaxed. I went in and they had a list of questions they wanted to ask. Fortunately for me, I was familiar with the individuals that were hiring.
Interview Questions: What success are you most proud of?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Good process with clear directions with the job. The people meeting was also helpful with details on the location and other details. The information needed to be successful was provided in detail.
Interview Questions: What is your future career plans?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by the manager who had worked there for more then 10 years she gave me detailed explanation of the job responsibilities and the skill sets required.
Interview Questions: How comfortable I was in communication and how good I was in handling emergency situations

title: Parking Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: just a sit down with one or two people and talking about the ins and outs of the job. normal paperwork things and going over references. Also we would go through campus
Interview Questions: what is your greatest strength

title: East Union Student Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: The manager first introduced the job requirements and talked about what is a typical day like. Then they will ask your background, follow up with some questions like what would you do in this situation?
Interview Questions:
1. What would you do in this situation?
2. How can better assistant our customers using your knowledge of the campus?
3. How will you introduce our customers to east campus?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a phone and in person interview. The in person interview was with a group that made up the hiring committee from various departments within the college as well as a 1:1 interview with the manager for the role.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to quickly react to solve an issue.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Short, not in-depth at all. Basic interview because they are professors, not recruiters. More like a conversation than an interview. Asked about grad exam scores and what my work style is. Nice and easy
Interview Questions: If I was motivated

title: Conference Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume online, as well as answered three essay questions and provided two references. I also had to take online tests for my personality and basic math and logic.
Interview Questions: Imagine a coworker.

title: Library Aid II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Apply online or in person. Takes about a week to process. Easy , relaxing interview and it is informal. Got hire in a fews day. If you have library work experience, it would be beneficial.
Interview Questions: Do you have work experience?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was a grant-funded, temporary, position.  I was referred by a current employee and contacted directly by the faculty member.  There was a face-to-face interview with the immediate supervisor that lasted for about 30 minutes.    It was fairly informal and friendly.
Interview Questions: The questions focused on my previous work experience and graduate education that was relevant to the position.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Was invited to interview with the marketing department, interview went well and sent follow up thank you email day after. Two weeks later still no word so sent another follow up. Said there was a hold with hr. Waited another 2 weeks and sent another follow up email, Said I didn't get the job. Wish I hadn't waited an entire month.
Interview Questions: worst experience you had with a client

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online application was followed by an on-campus interview. Very nice staff and warm ambiance. Campus interview was moreover what you would expect for a faculty  position than a middle range staff position (two rounds of interviews and a presentation).
Interview Questions: Tell us about something you had planned and didn't go the way you planned. What was your approach/response?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Omaha, NE) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews, they included two phone interviews with my supervisor, then with his supervisor then I met with them in person for a interview and was offered the position immediately after
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Director of Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Small panel of 4-5 members of the search committee. First met with search committee, then met alone with the director. It took awhile to hear back after initially submitting my application. They have to wait until the review date has passed before even beginning to look at applications. After finishing my interview, it took two days to be offered the job. I then had to pass a background test before I could officially be hired, which took around a week.
Interview Questions: Describe a project that you worked on from conception to completion

title: Computer Science Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Wilmington, DE)
Interview Descriptions: A full day spent meeting with 10-12 other teachers, a simulated class, and a lunch with students.  A huge part of it is seeing whether you can handle the stresses of such a long day.  Being nice to the staff is a must.
Interview Questions: My philosophy of teaching.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applications will not be reviewed until job posting is closed. After that, it can take 2-3 weeks to hear back for your first round of interviews. Usually begins with a phone interview, followed-up with in-person interviews
Interview Questions: How well can you handle multiple tasks at once?

title: Quality Assurance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was behavioral based; I was asked questions about past experiences and how I handled them, what choices I had to make, and how well I work in groups/ with others. They wanted to know details about how I convinced a teammate to change their mind, and when I had to be a team leader. They also wanted to know how, in a project, I went above and beyond what was expected of me.
Interview Questions: How did I change a teammate's mind from no to yes.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard university type interview. Presentation, questions, meetings with small groups and some students. Meetings with some support staff. Groups of faculty and staff with interests similar to mine. Lunches and dinners with interested parties. Breakfast meetings.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come here?

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple. A handful of people curious about what you want to do and what you want to get out of working for admissions. All of the people were super nice and UNL is a great place to work!
Interview Questions: How qualified I felt I was for the job?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: First contact through email, then very easy interview over the phone, description of the project and of the university. The recruiter spent more time talking than listening, which made it very easy. Overall very nice contact and I got an offer a couple of days later.
Interview Questions: technical questions

title: Financial Aid Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position in the Financial Aid Department, then was called for an interview 2 months later (after I had forgotten I had applied). The main interview was with the search committee (which, unlike UNL's policy on search committees, had no minorities on it). I was then moved to an interview with the entire office staff of over 15 who asked questions and finally the Director. Everyone was very nice and I was really looking forward to the prospect of working there. They said there would be an answer either by the end of he week when I left. I didn't hear back, so I sent a follow up email a few weeks later to no avail. The HR website states whether you're still in contention or not. They called all my references in this time frame, as well. I followed up one more time to no answer. After continuously checking the HR website, it finally said "not selected" over 3 months after the interview. My issue with this process is that I was not given the respect to get a decline email. As an Alum, I am very disappointed that this is how my alma mater treats potential employees.
Interview Questions: Lots of hypotheticals.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: just submit all the transcript and talkt to the professor and showed the professor what i can do and what's my focus and what's my view of renewable energy and then I'm hired
Interview Questions: to decide what's your research interest

title: College of Journalism and Mass Communications Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It consisted of a group interview with many opportunities to ask questions. The students were enthusiastic about the position and we all seemed to understand the stated roles well. I would strongly recommend other students looking to get involved to explore this as an option.
Interview Questions: How would you perform in this job?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Friendly and professional group . Had 3 rounds of phone interview with different level of management. Also 3 interviews in person after the phone conversations.
Paper work was easy process, quick and very convenient hiring process in general
Interview Questions: How would you explain the most complicated things to the employee ?

title: Extension Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 in person interviews, was offered a couple of days after second interview. They asked typical questions you'd expect in an interview.
Interview Questions: There weren't any unexpected questions

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was spread over two different days. However it took about six months from the application to actually be hired due to the incredibly slow process. This is one example of  the poor quality of the HR, Leadership/Administrators and business leaders employed at the University. Interview process is about 30 years behind the time. No testing is used throughout the process and resumes aren't run through a computer simulation to check fit prior to being reviewed by the "search committee." Interview panelist are never taught what to look for in a candidate so the questions and approach is pretty random.
Interview Questions: Really all softball questions, no behavioral based questions. Basically it boiled down to if the person across the table liked you.

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: UNL follows a very regulated hiring process.  Candidates are screened based on their application materials and chosen for interviews based primarily upon their qualifications.  Expect a panel of at least three people as University policy dictates that minorities and women are represented in every interview.  Prepare to answer specific questions about your experience and how it relates to a particular position.  Ultimately, the difficulty associated with your interview will depend upon the composition of the hiring committee.
Interview Questions: Explain to us how specifically how your previous experiences will translate into your role in this position.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: Hiring Criteria: Telephone interview, GRE Test scores, Graduate program Statement of interest.
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing this department and university?

title: Temporary Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Talk to the department chair about my desire to teach at UNL, and he asked some questions about teaching. Then we talk about what courses I can teach and what courses are available for the following semester.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach at UNL?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE)
Interview Descriptions: I talked to the PI of the lab and gave a talk about my PhD research. Then I talked to the lab member. He was very nice.
Interview Questions: What is your expectation from this job?

title: IT Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was simple. It didn't require any high technology knowledge.
Interview Questions: What was the largest problem I encountered and how did I resolve it?

title: Web Developer II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE)
Interview Descriptions:
Once you submit an application to UNL it can take two months before they respond.  They most likely will contact you via phone.  Once they contact you, they will setup an initial interview.  Here is where it gets interesting.  UNL uses search committees to hire people.  When you go in to interview, the search committee will most likely be in the interview (3+ people).

After the initial interview with the entire committee ensuring you are a good fit, you will then have a second interview.  This is basically an interview to ensure your potential boss knows you can do the job and will be a good fit in the company.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was a problem solving question for my skill.  It wasn't necessarily the question, but the question was the first one asked.  I had met the person in charge of the interview, and went to the meeting room.  There were five people in there already.  I wasn't expecting this at all.  So, the question is asked, and you have six people watching you try to figure out this problem.  Talk about tough.

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had to fill out an application that only a select few were given. Once that was completed, they invited anyone who they thought might meet the requirements to an on-site interview where the three supervisors all sat down and asked you questions.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an angry participant?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: There is a carousel interview made up of 5 tables. You spend about 8 minutes at each table, the rotate when the time is up. Each table has a different theme (diversity, involvement, conflict resolution, etc.) At each table is a Residence Director and a current RA. They are instructed to not say anything except to read you the prompt/question, and write down what you say.
Interview Questions: When was the last time you had to make a tough decision?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: This was a difficult position to interview for because it was a panel interview. It was tough because the people I spoke with were not easy to relate with, and they seemed to be tired from all of  the other interviews for that position. It was a hard interview and had a lot of behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Good and just email communications. I used google to search for the professor and send him an email. Afterwards, we just communicated with each other through email and asked questions to each other.
Interview Questions: Am I able to work hard even during weekends?

title: UCARE Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is virtually non-existant.  In order to secure research, the student needs to find a professor, discuss their interest, and submit a proposal.  The proposal is then reviewed by a panel and then possibly approved.  Once making a decision, the panel emails the applicants about the status of their application.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this research?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied via email and was asked to come in and meet with the supervisor.  After meeting with the supervisor I received a phone call about a month later from the supervisor asking if I was still interested in the job and then she discussed some of the specific details of the job and more of the in depth details of the research that was being conducted.
Interview Questions: How much animal experience do you have?

title: Members Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was basically a huge cattle call with first-come, first-serve. We all waited in the crowded lobby of the recreation facility and many had to wait over an hour to be interviewed. Most were dressed very casually-tshirts, shorts. When we finally got called in we sat in front of two current employees who were supposed to inform us about the job for the next interview, but did not and instead looked annoyed by us. Then we waited some more to see the head bosses who were friendly and understanding. Overall, I have never been to such a disorganized interview ever.
Interview Questions: There was a situation question about someone with the wrong id

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Talking about research background, class taken,      What you can do , how to handle the stress what are grades for classes
Interview Questions: What is your GRE scores

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
It was a whole day interview with many different professors that you might be interested in their research. 
Met coordinator first, then grad chair, then different professors that you might be interested in their research. It was a long day, but very helpful for you to know which professor was doing what research.
Interview Questions: what is your interest in chemistry research

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process was two days and met with several PIs.  Had general conversation with them about my research experience. Most individuals were very nice and wanted to discuss their research.  However, many PIs were misleading about funding levels and ability to support graduate students.
Interview Questions: What research experience do you have?

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: First interview was over the phone with the HR Specialist who asked general questions about my experience.  Second interview was also over the phone with the hiring manager who asked more detail question regarding my experience an how it matches with their job description.  Final Interview was at the office one with the hiring manager second with a Senior Business Systems Analyst and third group interview with other department heads.
Interview Questions: What do I see my self doing in my first 3 months to help resolve and bring solution to a project they were currently working on.

title: Facility Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska–Lincoln (Lincoln, NE) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by on-site lengthy interview by search committee and large group of managers
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?
